summary: FIDE is like a global club for chess players and fans. It was started in France in 1924 and now has over 200 countries as members. FIDE's job is to organize international chess competitions and make sure everyone plays by the same rules. They also give out titles to top players, like "Grandmaster." The group has a cool motto, "We are one family," showing that chess brings people together. Even the Olympic people think FIDE is important, so they recognized it in 1999.
title: FIDE
